title: Report Catalog Display and Metadata Accuracy
description: Verify that the Report Catalog Browser displays only authorized reports with correct and updated metadata including last viewed date and execution time.

steps.description: Login as authorized user and navigate to the Report Module main page
Check that only reports accessible to the user are listed
Verify metadata for each listed report includes correct last viewed date and last execution time formatted properly
Select multiple reports and confirm metadata updates after viewing each report
Ensure metadata reflects recent activity accurately and updates in real-time

title: Report Execution with Pagination and Sorting
description: Test report execution starts immediately upon clicking 'View', displays progress, shows data in a paginated and sortable table, and handles errors gracefully.

steps.description: Select a report from the catalog and click 'View'
Observe that execution starts immediately with a visible progress indicator
Verify that resulting data appears in a table with default pagination (e.g., 10 rows per page)
Sort by various columns in ascending and descending order
Confirm sorting updates the displayed data correctly without errors
Navigate between pages using pagination controls
Ensure pagination updates data displayed and controls reflect current page
Simulate report execution failure (e.g., backend error)
Confirm user is shown a clear error message and the UI recovers gracefully

title: Report Schema Display with Field Types and Calculations
description: Verify that the report schema view correctly displays field types, labels, calculated fields, and aggregation information.

steps.description: Open the schema details for a selected report
Check all fields are listed with accurate data types and user-friendly labels
Verify calculated fields show correct formulas and output data types
Validate aggregation metadata (SUM, AVG, MIN, MAX) is shown clearly

title: Report Customization: Multi-table Joins and Column Selection
description: Test the ability to add and remove linked tables, select specific columns, reorder fields, and automatic foreign key linking with real-time counters.

steps.description: Open report customization interface on an existing report
Add multiple related tables via multi-table join functionality
Verify tables are linked automatically using foreign keys
Select and deselect columns across all tables including 'select all' and 'deselect all' options
Confirm column counters update in real-time and users cannot remove the primary table
Reorder selected columns and observe the updated order reflected immediately
Ensure customization changes reflect accurately in the schema preview

title: Advanced Filtering with Multiple Conditions and Logical Operators
description: Validate filter creation supports multiple conditions with AND/OR logic, proper operators are shown per data type, and filters do not persist beyond session unless saved.

steps.description: Open the Advanced Filtering section in a report customization or execution view
Create various filter conditions using data-type specific operators (e.g. equals, contains, greater than)
Combine multiple conditions using AND/OR logic
Verify only appropriate operators are shown for each data type input
Apply filters and execute the report
Validate that the data returned respects the filter conditions
Refresh or close and reopen the report without saving filter preferences
Ensure filters do not persist and default to no filters

title: Calculated Fields Formula Validation and Output
description: Ensure calculated fields accept valid formulas with arithmetic operations and parentheses; validate syntax errors are caught; results render with correct data types.

steps.description: Attempt to create calculated fields using valid formulas including combinations of arithmetic operators and parentheses referencing existing fields
Verify system accepts formulas and shows output data type selection
Attempt to create calculated fields with invalid formulas (e.g., syntax errors, missing parentheses, invalid field references)
Confirm validation reports errors preventing save and guides user to fix formula
Use calculated fields in reports and execute
Check output values match expected computed results and data types

title: Aggregation and Grouping Functional Verification
description: Test SUM, AVG, MIN, MAX aggregation returns correct results when grouping by one or multiple fields; verify grouping segments data correctly.

steps.description: Create a report with numerical columns and apply aggregation functions (SUM, AVG, MIN, MAX)
Define grouping fields at single and multiple hierarchy levels
Verify aggregated values are calculated correctly by each group and subgroup based on source data
Remove grouping and check aggregation updates accordingly
Confirm aggregated results change consistent with the removal of groupings

title: Export to CSV, Excel, and PDF Formats
description: Validate that report data can be exported correctly to CSV, Excel (XLSX), and PDF formats with proper formatting and headers matching the report view.

steps.description: Execute a report with customized columns, filters, and sorting
Use export buttons and keyboard shortcut (Ctrl+E) to export report in CSV format
Verify exported CSV file contains correct data, headers, and formatting
Repeat export process for Excel format
Validate Excel file integrity, data types, formatting, and headers
Repeat export process for PDF format
Confirm PDF file displays formatted table with headers, pagination if applicable, and report metadata
Attempt exporting when no data is available
Confirm user receives error toast notification and no file is generated

title: User Preferences Persistence in LocalStorage and Supabase Backup
description: Verify that user preferences for columns, filters, and timestamps persist across sessions with fallback to localStorage and backup to Supabase.

steps.description: Customize a report with selected columns and filters
Save report preferences
Confirm preferences are saved to localStorage and backed up to Supabase
Close and reopen the application or reload the page
Verify user preferences are loaded automatically and applied in the report view
Simulate Supabase backup failure and check fallback to localStorage preferences load
Confirm preferences remain consistent and no data loss occurs

title: Report Scheduling and Automated Email Delivery
description: Test scheduling reports for automated execution at defined intervals with correct email distribution and failure notification.

steps.description: Schedule a report with parameters: frequency, recipients, and export format
Verify the report runs automatically at scheduled times
Confirm scheduled report export files are attached correctly in email sent to recipients
Simulate a failure in report execution or email delivery
Check that user receives failure toast notification with appropriate error message

title: Keyboard Shortcuts for Filtering and Exporting
description: Validate that keyboard shortcuts Ctrl+F and Ctrl+E trigger the filter interface and export function respectively during report viewing.

steps.description: Navigate to a report execution page with focus on the data table
Press Ctrl+F
Verify the filter interface opens and is focused for user input
Press Ctrl+E
Confirm the export options are triggered and last selected export happens
Press invalid key combinations
Verify no unintended actions occur

title: Clear User Feedback via Toast Notifications
description: Ensure the system displays toast notifications for success, error, and informational events timely and clearly.

steps.description: Perform actions such as saving preferences, exporting data, and triggering errors
Verify toast notifications display appropriate messages for success, errors, or information
Confirm notifications disappear after a reasonable timeout or can be manually dismissed

title: Security and Role-based Access Controls on Edit/Copy/Delete
description: Verify that edit, copy, and delete actions on report schemas are enforced based on user roles with confirmation dialogs and that copied reports do not affect originals.

steps.description: Login with a user having edit rights and attempt to edit, copy, and delete a report schema
Ensure actions succeed with confirmation dialogs presented before delete
Perform a report copy and verify the original schema remains unchanged
Check that the copied report is persisted as a separate schema and visible in report catalog
Login as a user without edit rights and verify edit, copy, delete actions are disabled or produce access denied messages
